definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: The ordinate scale is linear in decibels.
sentences.chinese: 縱座標比例尺以分貝爲單位是線性的。

sentences.english: The city-building generalization is important in automated generalization of large-scale map.
sentences.chinese: 大比例尺城市建築物綜合一直是自動綜合研究的重點。

sentences.english: A compressed horizontal scale commonly is helpful in seeing stratigraphic changes .
sentences.chinese: 縮小水平比例尺一般有助於觀察地層變化。

sentences.english: The large scale air photos showed a bright practical prospect.
sentences.chinese: 展示了用大比例尺航片量測的實用前景。

sentences.english: Scale in the original image was 1 kilometer (0.6 mile) per pixel.
sentences.chinese: 原始圖像的比例尺是每像素1千米。

sentences.english: A scale bar can also be shown by clicking the appropriate button.
sentences.chinese: 比例尺也可以通過單擊相應的按鈕顯示。

sentences.english: The scale of the map is 1: 460000.
sentences.chinese: 這張地圖的比例尺是四十六萬分之一。

sentences.english: Pay attention not to measure this drawing with scale. All measures are subject to figures in the drawing.
sentences.chinese: 本圖紙勿用比例尺度量，一切應依圖內數字所示爲準。

definition: a plan/a planar graph/a plane figure
arc length (the length of a curve segment)
